results.headline: Review: In ‘Mustang,’ Turkish Sisters and Traditions Clash
results.summary_short: This debut feature by Deniz Gamze Ergüven concerns five spirited youngsters and the efforts of their relatives to control them as custom dictates.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mustang

results.headline: Review: ‘Criminal Activities,’ a Crime Yarn With John Travolta
results.summary_short: Mr. Travolta plays a crime boss with a get-rich-quick investment scheme in this movie from Jackie Earle Haley.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Criminal Activities

results.headline: Review: ‘Carol’ Explores the Sweet Science of Magnetism
results.summary_short: Two women fall in love in this new film from Todd Haynes, based on the Patricia Highsmith novel “The Price of Salt.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Carol

results.headline: Review: ‘The Summer of Sangaile,’ Evanescent and Too Good to Be True
results.summary_short: Two very young women find each other and fall in love in this film from the Lithuanian writer and director Alante Kavaite.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Summer of Sangaile

results.headline: Review: ‘Sweet Micky for President’: How a Pop Star Came to Lead Haiti
results.summary_short: Ben Patterson’s flattering documentary goes on the campaign trail in Haiti with Michel Martelly, but rolls the credits after he wins the election.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sweet Micky For President

results.headline: Review: ‘Secret in Their Eyes,’ a 13-Year Hunt for a Killer
results.summary_short: This remake of an Argentine Oscar-winning film centers on the murder of the daughter of an investigator for the Los Angeles District Attorney’s Office.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Secret in Their Eyes

results.headline: Review: ‘Legend,’ Starring Tom Hardy as the Gangster Twins Ronnie and Reggie Kray
results.summary_short: Brian Helgeland’s film immerses viewers in the sights and sounds of swinging ’60s London, showing how the brothers capitalized on their strutting image.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Legend

results.headline: Review: ‘Kingdom of Shadows,’ a Documentary on the Drug War in Mexico
results.summary_short: Bernardo Ruiz’s documentary takes a front-line look at the grip of Mexican drug cartels from the perspective of three main figures.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Kingdom of Shadows

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Night Before,’ a Search for the Holiday Party of the Century
results.summary_short: Seth Rogen, Anthony Mackie and Joseph Gordon-Levitt star as friends honoring their Christmas Eve tradition of holiday debauchery.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Night Before

results.headline: Review: In ‘Censored Voices,’ Soldiers Reflect on the Six-Day War
results.summary_short: In a film by Mor Loushy, Amos Oz and Avraham Shapira revisit talks they recorded with Israeli soldiers returning from the conflict in 1967.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Censored Voices

results.headline: Review: ‘#Horror’ Finds the Fear in Cyberbullying and Social Media Threats
results.summary_short: In this feature directorial debut by Tara Subkoff, girls neglected by their parents and obsessed with their cellphones fall prey to perils of the online world.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of #Horror

results.headline: Review: ‘Frame by Frame’ Looks at Four Intrepid Afghan Photojournalists
results.summary_short: In Alexandria Bombach and Mo Scarpelli’s documentary, the suffering the photographers capture tends to undercut the film’s focus on their journalism.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Frame by Frame

results.headline: Review: ‘Drone’ Documentary Examines a New Weapon
results.summary_short: The filmmaker Tonje Hessen Schei looks at the morality and consequences of armed drone use.

results.headline: Review: ‘Democrats,’ Chronicling Politics in Zimbabwe
results.summary_short: This documentary from Camilla Nielsson looks at recent efforts to put a constitution into place in that country.

results.headline: Review: ‘Prem Ratan Dhan Payo,’ a Bollywood Tale of a Prince-and-Plebe Double
results.summary_short: Sooraj R. Barjatya’s film stars Salman Khan as a decent and playful fellow who intervenes in the power battles of a royal family.

results.headline: Review: In ‘James White,’ Facing Adulthood With Uncertainty
results.summary_short: The title character, played by Christopher Abbott, grapples with his future while caring for his ailing mother in this Josh Mond film.

results.headline: Review: ‘Entertainment’ Features a Comic Who Is Cracking Up
results.summary_short: Gregg Turkington plays a version of his real-life stand-up persona, performing gigs at seedy clubs in the California desert, in Rick Alverson’s film.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Entertainment

results.headline: Review: ‘The 33’ Recalls a Chilean Mine Disaster and the Men Who Endured It
results.summary_short: In this stirring and suspenseful story, trapped miners wait underground to be rescued, grappling with fear and bonding as brothers.

results.headline: Review: ‘Steve McQueen: The Man & Le Mans,’ a Documentary
results.summary_short: A look at the making of McQueen’s 1971 movie, “Le Mans,” about that 24-hour sports car race in France.

results.headline: Review: ‘Song of Lahore’ Chronicles a Pakistani Jazz Ensemble’s American Triumph
